properties.headline: Flood Warning issued March 2 at 3:34PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the Missouri River near
Williston, affecting Williams and McKenzie Counties of North Dakota.

.Warm temperatures will continue to clean snowpack off the
countryside and increase river flows. Much of the cause behind this
event can be attributed to the ice covering the river. As the river
rises, the risk of the ice becoming mobile increases as will the
risk of an icejam. If an icejam were to occur, water levels can
quickly rise and fall several feet within a few hours.  .

The Flood Warning continues for
the Missouri River near Williston.
* From Tuesday evening until further notice.
* At 8:45 AM CST Monday / 7:45 AM MST Monday the stage was 21.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 22.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage
tomorrow evening and continue rising to a crest of 23.5 feet early
Friday afternoon.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet, Ditches in the vicinity of the river will
fill and wildlife management lands along the south banks will
begin to flood.
* Impact...At 22.0 feet, Low-lying farmland and access roads to oil
well sites near Trenton are flooded. City of Williston does not
flood.
* Impact...At 24.0 feet, Water begins to cover oil well location
south and east of Williston. Wildlife management areas are
flooded. City of Williston does not flood.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2
feet on 06/30/2008.
properties.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive on
flooded roads.

Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Additional forecast information is available under the Rivers and
Lakes tab at www.weather.gov/bis.

NWSheadline: The Flood Warning remains in effect
